The Biome is a new kind of K-5 school, for the next generation – one that offers customized, project-based and student-centered learning opportunities with an emphasis on growth mindset and STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Art and Mathematics) education. The Biome charter school creates a balanced learning ecosystem in which teachers work together with students to cultivate a growth mindset as they discover their unique gifts, talents, and interests.

We engage students in an individualized and challenging, yet nurturing, educational environment, enriching their minds and cultivating confident and creative builders of the future. Our integrated approach promotes interdisciplinary, inventive thinking.

We are now enrolling for children entering Kindergarten for the 2020-2021 school year. If you are interested in enrolling at The Biome for the 2020-2021school year, please complete the Pre-Enrollment form below.

Please stay safe and look for additional updates soon.

post_text: A while back our learners discovered that Annie "the escape artist" kept finding her way out of the chicken coop, and they identified some areas that needed reinforcement. Fortunately, we have handy staff members and volunteers who could help! Ms. Sullivan and her team fixed and added on to The Biome's chicken coop to give our feathered friends even more space. They used the old coop and built a doorway between the two and also added shelves to support the enrichment items and their food so, less falls out in the wind. Thanks to this team work, Annie and Magnolia have a pad that's even more plush!

(A message from Bill Kent, President & CEO)
After 14 years of dedicated service to our mission and the well-being of our students, Michele Mosely will be leaving The Biome School. Her last day with us will be September 26, 2019. Michele has accepted a new position as the Program Manager of Ascension's Marillac Mission Fund (formerly Daughters of Charity Foundation).

Among her many accomplishments, Michele has most importantly brought needed financial resources and community partnerships to our learners. She has also served as an outspoken advocate for the social and emotional development of our children. Please join me in wishing Michele success in her next adventure. No matter where she goes, she will forever be part of The Biome Family.

Our #ThankfulThursdays message today shines a light upon an amazing addition to The Biome School, our brand new green house! On Friday, our new 200 square foot green house was officially dedicated with a ribbon cutting ceremony. In addition to entering the green house for the first time and learning about their new plants from scientists, our learners also got to hang out with Dr. Health E. Hound and former St. Louis Cardinals pitcher, Brad Thompson.

The Biome is thankful for our partners at UnitedHealthcare and at Donald Danforth Plant Science Center for contributing this great resource to our learning ecosystem. We also thank Arcadia GlassHouse, Dreambuilders USA, and everyone else who made this installation and special dedication possible. Our teachers and learners are excited about the fact that the study of plant sciences and healthy food choices will always be a hands-on experience at The Biome! #TheBiomeIsGrateful

You may have run into some of the Young Friends at Cocktails for Causes last night! The Young Friends of the Biome are active at school events and coordinate their own volunteering and networking events to increase awareness and visibility of The Biome. Their efforts raise funds to advance the mission of The Biome School and help kids be happy, healthy, confident learners.

You can meet the Young Professionals at their upcoming The Biome School Friendraiser on Thursday, July 25! Refreshments will be provided.

Our learners loved planting a vertical garden this year! If you're looking for more ways to connect with nature this summer, we suggest heading to the Missouri Botanical Garden (they even have free admission days!). This magical attraction has a Climatron, a Japanese Garden, and a Children's Garden where you can learn all about science, conservation, and sustainability. Over one million people come to visit the Botanical Garden each year, and we are lucky enough to have it in our backyard!

St. Louis City and County residents (with proof of residency) receive free general Garden admission on Wednesday and Saturday mornings from 7 a.m. to noon. To learn more, visit www.missouribotanicalgarden.org #MissouriBotanicalGarden

For our last science project with ThermoFisher Scientific this summer, our learners explored density! With the Thermo Fisher scientists, we hypothesized and tested what objects would float or sink in different liquids. Then we got to make our own "rainbow jars" by layering colorful liquids of different densities!

We want to give a big thank you to Thermo Fischer Scientific and their leaders who volunteered their time. Our learners LOVED asking real scientists questions, making discoveries, and getting their hands dirty in science experiments all summer! #ThermoFischerScientific #SummerScience
